title: Deb Haaland
deleted: Haaland's Senate confirmation hearings were held on February 23 and 24, 2021, after which several Republican senators including [[John Barrasso]] (R), [[Steve Daines]] (R) and [[Mike Rounds]] (R)<ref>Rachel Frazen, "Indigenous groups pressure Senators through Deb Haaland billboards", The Hill, February 26, 2021, [https://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/540729-indigenous-groups-pressure-senators-through-deb-haaland-billboards]</ref> have been accused of bias<ref name=Pbs>Felicia Fonseca and Matthew Brown, "Interior Secretary nominee Deb Haaland's grilling raises questions on bias", PBS with Associated Press, February 26, 2021,  [https://www.pbs.org/newshour/politics/interior-secretary-nominee-deb-haalands-grilling-raises-questions-on-bias]</ref> and disrespect.<ref name=Auntie>Arianna Amehae, "'Like watching your Auntie being verbally abused' Indigenous community members reflect on Deb Haaland's hearing", Native News Online, February 26, 2021, [https://nativenewsonline.net/currents/like-watching-your-auntie-being-verbally-abused-indigenous-community-members-reflect-on-deb-haaland-s-hearing]</ref>

The Republican Senators also did not respond to Haaland's repeated efforts<ref>Arianna Amehae, "Haaland retains her composure in the face of immense disrespect in confirmation hearing", Native News Online, February 23, 2021, [https://nativenewsonline.net/currents/haaland-retains-her-composure-in-the-face-of-immense-disrespect-in-confirmation-hearing]</ref> to discuss the [[Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women]] in response to their concerns for the petroleum industry and its employees. During the confirmation hearings, [[Enbridge]] Line 3 petroleum pipeline employees were arrested and charged with human trafficking.<ref name=Auntie/>

Haaland has received important support from the Senate's committee chairperson, [[Joe Manchin]]. Additional support for Haaland amongst the other Democratic Senators is sufficient for her to be confirmed as the Secretary for the Interior.<ref name=Pbs/>

title: Deb Haaland
deleted: | office3             = Tribal Administrator of the [[San Felipe Pueblo, New Mexico|San Felipe Pueblo]]

title: Deb Haaland
added: Haaland was born in [[Winslow, Arizona]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://insideelections.com/news/article/candidate-conversation-deb-haaland-d|title=Candidate Conversation - Deb Haaland (D)|publisher=Inside Elections|location=Washington DC|website=insideelections.com|access-date=October 27, 2018|archive-date=November 16, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181116093043/https://insideelections.com/news/article/candidate-conversation-deb-haaland-d|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Peters |first=Joey |url=http://nmpoliticalreport.com/3183/haaland-elected-new-democratic-party-chair/ |title=Haaland elected new state Democratic Party Chair |website=New Mexico Political Report |date=April 26, 2015 |access-date=June 6, 2018 |archive-date=July 11, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180711230149/http://nmpoliticalreport.com/3183/haaland-elected-new-democratic-party-chair/ |url-status=live }}</ref> She is an enrolled member of the [[Laguna Pueblo]].<ref>{{Cite magazine|first=Katie|last=Reilly|title=This Single Mother Could Be the First Native American in Congress|url=https://time.com/5304507/deb-haaland-first-native-american-congresswoman/|date=June 7, 2018|access-date=September 9, 2020|magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|archive-date=August 10, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200810063943/https://time.com/5304507/deb-haaland-first-native-american-congresswoman/|url-status=live}}</ref> The Pueblo people have lived on the land that is now the state of New Mexico since the 1200s and Haaland identifies herself as a 35th-generation New Mexican.<ref name=":1" /><ref>{{Cite news|last=Jenkins|first=Cameron|date=November 11, 2020|title=Deb Haaland says 'of course' she would serve as Interior secretary under Biden|url=https://thehill.com/homenews/news/525434-deb-haaland-says-of-course-she-would-serve-as-interior-secretary-under-biden|access-date=November 22, 2020|newspaper=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]]|archive-date=November 18, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201118063916/https://thehill.com/homenews/news/525434-deb-haaland-says-of-course-she-would-serve-as-interior-secretary-under-biden|url-status=live}}</ref> Her mother, Mary Toya,<ref name=alb/> a [[Native Americans in the United States|Native American woman]], served in the [[United States Navy]].<ref name="could make history"/> Her father, Major J. D. "Dutch" Haaland, a white American born in Minnesota, was an officer in the [[United States Marine Corps]] and recipient of the [[Silver Star]] for his actions in [[Vietnam War|Vietnam]]; he was buried with full military honors at [[Arlington National Cemetery]] in 2005.<ref name="alb">{{cite web|url=http://obits.abqjournal.com/obits/show/151921|title=Obituaries: Haaland|date=March 4, 2005|access-date=June 22, 2018|work=[[Albuquerque Journal]]|archive-date=June 22, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180622060047/http://obits.abqjournal.com/obits/show/151921|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Ellenberg|first=Richard|date=2018-09-30|title=Deb Haaland Biography, Wiki, Age, Husband, Net Worth, Daughter, Family, New Mexico's 1st congressional district Democrat Nominee|url=https://globintel.com/usa/deb-haaland-biography-wiki-age-husband-net-worth-daughter-family-new-mexicos-1st-congressional-district-democrat-nominee/|access-date=2021-03-09|website=Glob Intel {{!}} Celebrity News {{!}} Sports {{!}} Tech|language=en-US}}</ref> <ref>{{Cite web|title=John David “Dutch” Haaland (1936-2005) - Find A...|url=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49195076/john-david-haaland|access-date=2021-03-09|website=www.findagrave.com|language=en}}</ref> As [[Military brat (U.S. subculture)|a child in a military family]], Haaland moved frequently.<ref name=":2">{{Cite magazine|last=McGrady|first=Clyde|title=Haaland recalls struggles as single mom, Thanksgiving and being homeless|url=https://www.rollcall.com/2019/09/16/haaland-recalls-struggles-as-single-mom-thanksgiving-and-being-homeless/|access-date=November 23, 2020|magazine=[[Roll Call (magazine)|Roll Call]]|date=September 16, 2019|archive-date=December 8, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201208013015/https://www.rollcall.com/2019/09/16/haaland-recalls-struggles-as-single-mom-thanksgiving-and-being-homeless/|url-status=live}}</ref> She attended 13 public schools across the United States before the family settled in [[Albuquerque, New Mexico]], to be close to family who also belong to the Laguna Pueblo.<ref name=":3">{{Cite news|last=Boetel|first=Ryan|date=October 10, 2020|title='Proud progressive,' Haaland seeks 2nd term|url=https://www.abqjournal.com/1505620/proud-progressive-haaland-seeks-2nd-term.html|access-date=November 23, 2020|newspaper=[[Albuquerque Journal]]|archive-date=October 23, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201023022700/https://www.abqjournal.com/1505620/proud-progressive-haaland-seeks-2nd-term.html|url-status=live}}</ref> Haaland graduated from [[Highland High School (Albuquerque, New Mexico)|Highland High School]] in Albuquerque.<ref name=":2" /><ref name=":3" /> She has three sisters and a brother.<ref name=alb/>

title: Deb Haaland
deleted: Making history is one of the best things you can do as a minority group in American politics. New Mexico Rep. Deb Haaland is doing just that and more when she got confirmed by the senate to be the Interior Secretary. [[United States Senate]] Democrat [[Tina Smith]] had a good take on this moment saying that “time after time, strong women, and especially women of color, are attacked when white men with the same views are welcome to walk right through that door, unopposed”. It is extremely important that the senate be as diverse at least as much as it is compared to the United States.<ref></ref>

Native American people have always been underrepresented in congress and underpaid for the crimes committed that were committed against them. Rep. Haaland is an enrolled citizen of the Pueblo of Laguna Native American tribe in New Mexico. She will have a diverse take on issues that we are facing as a nation. Especially when the issues revolve around land rights, health care, and sacred site protection. All environmental groups are excited to have a great addition to the Democratic party. The recent legislation drafted on environmental issues seems to line up perfectly with the values of Rep. Haaland.<ref></ref>
